pullRequest.title: #559 Refactor IOSConfiguration to ReleaseConfiguration
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #559 by adding iOS and Android release configuration.
A follow-up PR is required in Client plugin to accommodate these changes

commit.message: #559 Refactor IOSConfiguration to ReleaseConfiguration, to extend it for iOS and Android configuration
Apply changes for Android target, including test
Update initial plist when different values in releaseConfiguration are set
Update user’s manifest when there are changes set in releaseConfiguration

nodes.bodyText: There should be a check for empty passwords. In any case, can't we even skip printing the first character of passwords?
Change printed variable name as well.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -298,7 +298,7 @@ public String toString() {
                 ", compilerArgs=" + compilerArgs +
                 ", appId='" + appId + '\'' +
                 ", appName='" + appName + '\'' +
-                ", iosConfiguration='" + iosSigningConfiguration + '\'' +
+                ", iosConfiguration='" + releaseConfiguration + '\'' +

nodes.bodyText: Change printed variable name as well.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -498,7 +497,7 @@ public String toString() {
                 ", runtimeArgsList=" + runtimeArgsList +
                 ", releaseSymbolsList=" + releaseSymbolsList +
                 ", appName='" + getAppName() + '\'' +
-                ", iosConfiguration='" + iosSigningConfiguration + '\'' +
+                ", iosConfiguration='" + releaseConfiguration + '\'' +

nodes.bodyText: itemName refers to an XML attribute of the XML element tag? Perhaps rename it to attributeName?
Did you really mean contains instead of equals? If so, you might want to add this information in the javadoc.

Instead of the Optional pattern, you might want to consider this:
String bundleName = Objects.requireNonNullElse(releaseConfiguration.getBundleName(), appName);
Are you sure that keyPass and keyStorePass shouldn't be switched?
